evidence: With the increase in Nb content, the yield strength slightly decreased from 1160 to 980 MPa and the hardness dropped from 338 to 310 HV. Moreover, the alloys exhibited low density from 6.47 to 6.84 g/cm 3
The yield strength of the alloys increased from 405 to 859 MPa... with the addition of Nb element at 873 K
The yield strength of the alloys increased from 85 to 195 MPa with the addition of Nb element at 1073 K

At RT, all the Ti 2 ZrHf 0.5 VNb x alloys exhibit excellent compressive plasticity of over 50%, the yield strength has slight decrease from 1160 to 980 MPa with the increase in Nb content due to the reduction of lattice distortion. The Ti 2 ZrHf 0.5 VNb x alloys also possess low density less than 6.84 g/cm 3 and high specific yield strength (179 kPa m 3 /kg) which are greater than most of RHEAs, and even HEAs.

The addition of Nb element into the Ti 2 ZrHf 0.5 V alloy significantly improves the high-temperature strength and soften resistance. Thereinto, the Nb 1 alloy can remain a high yield strength ~ 850 MPa at 873 K, and it only reduced by 12.3% compared with that at RT.
